programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach putting grips, styles and drills used by the world's best players; learn how to stop pushing putts like Tiger Woods, eliminate the pull like Scottie Scheffler and put better roll on the ball like Dave Stockton.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach how to stick your mid range to full swing wedge shots; learn how to make solid contact like Collin Morikawa, hit it straight down your target line like Steve Stricker and control distance like Rory McIlroy.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach drills to cure the worst swing faults; learn how to improve your swing plane like Tiger Woods, use a pool noodle to eliminate the chicken wing and fix numerous faults that cause a slice.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach the best drills from the best guests in School of Golf history; Martin will also reveal the most special guest in the show's 15 year history and teach a tip that helped them become a champion.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: We celebrate the final chapter of School of Golf with Martin Hall; the Professor teaches the drills that have helped the most players over the past 15 seasons.

programme.title: 5 Clubs with Gary Williams
programme.desc: Viewpoints of people in the game with people who love the game; we discuss what is of interest to them in the vast and deep reservoir of stories within the game of golf.

programme.title: Fairways of Life
programme.desc: New York Times's Best Seller and Golf Channel Host Matt Adams provides unforgettable interviews with golf's legends and stars, as well as lively interactive discussions about the game, travel and the latest in golf equipment.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: Brittany Lincicome welcomes Martin Hall to discuss all she has to offer to help with your full swing. Brittany discusses ways she hits far and straight with the driver, but also how to control her finesse wedge shots.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: Two-time major champion Brittany Lincicome welcomes 2008 PGA Teacher of the Year Martin Hall to discuss how to help with the short game.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: U.S. Solheim Cup team member Brittany Lincicome welcomes Martin Hall to Tranquilo Golf Club in Orlando, Florida, to discuss all she has to offer to help with putting.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn unique drills using a cell phone charger, headcover, rope and tree branch that will all increase your clubhead speed; Devan will also give an in-depth swing analysis on Cameron Young and teach his checkpoints for maximum power.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake is fixing the biggest contact faults to make you a better ball striker; learn how a wall can be used to cure fat and thin shots plus Devan's best drill for preventing the shanks.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake is teaching how to stick your wedges and make more birdies; learn the biggest swing keys that make Justin Thomas one of the best wedge players in the world.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake is putting you on a path to lower scores by improving your swing path; learn setup adjustments, swing keys and creative drills for hitting draws and fades on command.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn how cross-handed chipping helped Matthew Fitzpatrick win the U.S. Open, keys to spinning your wedges like Max Homa and the reason John Daly practices one-arm pitch shots.

programme.title: Playing Lessons

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: Jim "Bones" Mackay travels to Las Vegas to meet up with LPGA Tour winner Jenny Shin on the course for Part 1 of a 2-part series. Jenny shares her tips andstrategies that have led to her LPGA career of over a decade.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: Golf stars offer instruction.

programme.title: 3 Keys to Every Shot
programme.desc: Nick Dougherty analyzes the swings of Rory McIlroy, Collin Morikawa and Jon Rahm to teach the three keys to a variety of challenging golf shots.

programme.title: Swing Expedition With Chris Como
programme.sub-title: Martin Hall - How the Professor Teaches
programme.desc: Chris Como spends a day with "School of Golf" host Martin Hall in his natural habitat; how to visualize the golf swing; how the club path and face affect the swing; how to achieve an ideal impact position; how to find a safe go-to shot.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal kick off the season by teaching the biggest keys to solid contact. Learn swing tips used by pros that will help improve ball striking. One of the best training aids for improving impact can be found in the kitchen.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach the key shots needed to save strokes around the green. Learn wedge play tips used by Seve Ballesteros and a scrambling secret from Annika Sorenstam. Martin also teaches how to hit numerous other short game shots.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach what to learn from the game's longest drivers past and present. Learn what Arnold Palmer did to maximize distance, a drill used by Rory McIlroy, and the swing keys of 2-time World Long Drive Champion Kyle Berkshire.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach how to escape the sand like some of the game's all-time greats. Learn how to spin greenside bunker shots like Gary Player,cure one of the biggest short game faults with a Phil Mickelson move.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach how to recreate iconic shots hit by winners of the Arnold Palmer Invitational. Martin also shares tips to improve ball striking from Arnold Palmer.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: The biggest keys to stopping the slice and improving the backswing featuring a drill using a basketball and a tip from Nick Faldo. LPGA winner Matilda Castren demonstrates what she does in practice before every tournament to prevent slicing the ball.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal share putting pointers from the game's best players. Learn how to control speed on the greens like Tiger Woods, improve balance like Jack Nicklaus, square the putter face, and find the right putting grip.

programme.title: 5 Clubs with Gary Williams
programme.desc: Viewpoints of people in the game with people who love the game; we discuss what is of interest to them in the vast and deep reservoir of stories within the game of golf.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: The players compete for a season-long Super Immunity prize, which could give one competitor a distinct advantage over his/her opponents.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: The player holding Super Immunity receives an extra incentive to stay out of the elimination challenge. Competitors must make crucial decisions to earn immunity, and one player attempts to bait the competition into an early exit from the show.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: Players must traverse the flop wall and successfully predict their opponents' outcomes in order to gain immunity; a questionable strategy threatens to send one player home.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: Players must choose teams at breakfast; and one captain bases selections on personal relationships. Meanwhile, another player makes no friends in a move that turns the entire series on an emotional roller coaster.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: Competitors must rely on one another to earn safety as team formats rule the challenges. A shaky performance must be overcome to keep the Super Immunity out of play, while an unexpected twist sends players directly to the elimination challenge.
